alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the carbonic acid functional group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic carbonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds that results from the interaction between a positive ion and the negatively charge oxygen atom of the carbonate ion.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonate salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
alternative_parents.name: Organic salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds formally derived from ammonia by replacing one, two or three hydrogen atoms by hydrocarbyl groups, and having the general structures RNH2 (primary amines), R2NH (secondary amines), R3N (tertiary amines).
alternative_parents.name: Amines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds with a positive electric charge.
alternative_parents.name: Organic cations

class.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
class.name: Organonitrogen compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quaternary ammonium salts. These are compounds containing positively charged polyatomic ion of the structure NR4+, R being an alkyl group or an aryl group.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing positively charged polyatomic ion of the structure NR4+, R being an alkyl group or an aryl group.
direct_parent.name: Quaternary ammonium salts

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing positively charged polyatomic ion of the structure NR4+, R being an alkyl group or an aryl group.
subclass.name: Quaternary ammonium salts

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
superclass.name: Organic nitrogen compounds
